title: Bird Flu Vaccines 2023
author: Staff
description: Avian influenza (bird flu) vaccines are U.S. FDA approved and available in 2023.
cleaned_text: Bird Flu Vaccines 2023 Avian Influenza Pandemic Vaccines August 2023 The U.S. National Influenza Vaccine Modernization [Strategy](https://www.phe.gov/Preparedness/planning/nivms/Documents/nivms-2020-2030.pdf) and the American Pandemic Preparedness Plan outlined the United States' (U.S.) [priorities](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/NAT-COVID-19-PREPAREDNESS-PLAN.pdf) in avian influenza vaccines. According to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention ( [CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/avianflu/human-cases-cambodia.htm)), in [June 2023](https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2023/062023_slides.pdf), about 20 million H5N1 and 12 million H7N9 vaccines were available in the U.S. [National Strategic Stockpile](https://aspr.hhs.gov/SNS/Pages/default.aspx). The U.S. CDC also confirmed an H5 candidate vaccine virus ( [CVV](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/avianflu/candidate-vaccine-virus.htm)) similar Development ( [pg. 37](https://emergency.cdc.gov/coca/ppt/2023/062023_slides.pdf)) was updated on June 20, 2023. Furthermore, the CDC confirmed as of June 2023, annual [flu shots](https://www.precisionvaccinations.com/vaccines/influenza-vaccines) are unlikely to protect people during avian influenza ( [bird flu](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/avianflu/avian-flu-summary.htm)) HAPI pandemics. CSL Seqirus [announced](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/csl-seqirus-announces-third-us-government-award-in-relation-to-influenza-ah5n8-candidate-vaccine-301911153.html) on August 28, 2023, that BARDA selected the company to deliver one bulk lot of H5N8 A/Astrakhan antigen to support the U.S. government's pandemic response readiness under contract number [75A50122D00004](https://www.highergov.com/idv/75A50122D00004/) ($46.3 million). This is the third award CSL Seqirus has received from BARDA related to the ongoing outbreak of HPAI, following the February 2022 award to produce an H5N8 A/Astrakhan virus vaccine seed and the subsequent October 2022 announcement of the selection of CSL Seqirus to deliver an [H5N8 A/Astrakhan](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9227545/) virus vaccine candidate for assessment in a Phase 2 clinical study. Under the $30.1 million agreement, BARDA is [partnering](https://www.medicalcountermeasures.gov/newsroom/2022/influenzavaccines/) with GSK and CSL Seqirus to manufacture investigational lots of [H5N8](https://www.who.int/emergencies/disease-outbreak-news/item/2021-DON313) vaccines and clinically assess the safety, immunogenicity, and dose-sparing ability of adjuvants in combination with the manufactured vaccine candidates. CSL Seqirus established and will maintain the required pandemic readiness to deliver 150 million doses of cell-based pandemic influenza vaccine within six months of an influenza pandemic declaration in the U.S. In 2022, the [Holly Springs](https://www.cslseqirus.us/news/seqirus-holly-springs-manufacturing-facility-designated-by-us-government-as-pandemic-ready) facility successfully achieved all of BARDA's criteria required to establish domestic manufacturing capability for innovative cell-based seasonal and pandemic influenza vaccines. On October 5, 2022, CSL [announced](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/csl-announces-positive-preclinical-data-for-self-amplifying-messenger-rna-sa-mrna-influenza-vaccine-candidates-301641467.html) results from the preclinical studies of the company's self-amplifying messenger RNA ( [sa-mRNA](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41434-020-00204-y)) influenza vaccine candidates. The data, [published](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2329050122001383) in Molecular Therapy - Methods and Clinical Development, indicate that the sa-mRNA influenza vaccine candidates produced a potent, cross-reactive immune response against pandemic and seasonal influenza strains, A(H5N1) and A(H1N1) ( [Swine flu](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/pandemic-resources/2009-h1n1-pandemic.html)). [Marc Fesneau](https://agriculture.gouv.fr/90e-organisation-mondiale-de-la-sante-animale-paris-la-lutte-contre-linfluenza-aviaire-au-coeur-des), Minister of Agriculture and Food Sovereignty, called for all avenues to be explored to improve the fight against HPAI, foremost among which is vaccination on May 22, 2023. Temporary authorization for use has recently been submitted for [vaccines for poultry](https://agriculture.gouv.fr/influenza-aviaire-mobilisation-generale-pour-faire-face-la-resurgence-de-foyers-dans-le-sud-ouest) being assessed by the French Agency for Veterinary Medicinal Products ( [ANMV](https://www.anses.fr/en/content/french-agency-veterinary-medicinal-products%E2%80%93-missions-and-activities#:~:text=The%20French%20Agency%20for%20Veterinary%20Medicinal%20Products%20(ANMV)%2C%20within,regard%20to%20veterinary%20medicinal%20products.)) and the European Medicines Agency ( [EMA](https://www.ema.europa.eu/en/human-regulatory/overview/public-health-threats/pandemic-influenza/vaccines-pandemic-influenza)). Only one chicken vaccine ( [Gallus gallus species](https://animaldiversity.org/accounts/Gallus_gallus/)) has marketing authorization in France ( [2006](https://www.anses.fr/en/content/avian-influenza-chickens-cannot-be-vaccinated-winter#)). Vaccination application needs to be managed along the supply chain, including a surveillance program to detect active infection in vaccinated animals," said Dr. David Swayne, Disease Expert and Forum rapporteur. The United States Department of Agriculture's Agricultural Research Service (APHIS) researchers [confirmed](https://www.usda.gov/media/press-releases/2023/04/14/fact-sheet-usda-continues-partner-engagement-mitigate-highly) on April 14, 2023, that they are currently testing several vaccine candidates. On May 16, 2023, [APHIS approved](https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/newsroom/stakeholder-info/sa_by_date/sa-2023/ca-condor-hpai) the emergency use of an HPAI vaccine to prevent additional deaths of [California Condors](https://www.fws.gov/story/2023-05/california-condor-hpai-response-update-may-12-2023). The authorized vaccine is a killed, inactivated product conditionally licensed by APHIS' Center for Veterinary Biologics in 2016. Since the vaccine has not previously been tested against this strain of the HAPI virus in these species, the first step is a pilot safety study in North American vultures, a similar species. This vaccine trial will be conducted with surrogate vultures in North Carolina. As of June 2, 2023, [all vultures](https://www.fws.gov/story/2023-06/california-condor-hpai-response-update-june-2-2023) that received the HPAI vaccine as part of the initial trial on May 16 appear to be in good health with no vaccine site reactions. Depending on the results of this trial, the second step would be to implement the test on 25 captive California condors. The [DIVA strategy](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12745380/) uses an inactivated oil emulsion vaccine containing the same haemagglutinin (H) subtype as the challenge virus but a different neuraminidase (N). The possibility of using the heterologous N subtype to differentiate between vaccinated and naturally infected birds was investigated by developing an "ad hoc" serological test to detect specific [anti-N1 antibodies](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5790960/). Bird Flu Medications The U.S. CDC currently recommends [antiviral medicines](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/pandemic-resources/monitoring/irat-virus-summaries.htm#table-summaries) for people who contract bird flu. However, some evidence of [antiviral resistance](https://asm.org/Articles/2022/July/Avian-Influenza-Past,-Present,-Future#:~:text=HPAI%20A(H5N1)%20is%20one,without%20any%20signs%20of%20illness.) has been reported in HPAI Asian lineage avian influenza A(H5N1) viruses ("Asian H5N1 viruses") and Asian lineage avian influenza A( [H7N9](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/avianflu/h7n9-virus.htm)) viruses. However, testing is more accurate when the swab is collected during the first few days of illness.
